conclusion: Analyze the flow path of the liquid from each inlet through the baffles.
Inlet A is located at the top left corner.
Liquid from Inlet A will move downward and to the right, passing through the yellow and brown baffles, leading towards container E.
Inlet B is located at the top center.
Liquid from Inlet B will move downward, passing through the green and brown baffles, leading towards container E.
Inlet C is located at the top right center.
Liquid from Inlet C will move downward, passing through the blue and gray baffles, leading towards container F.
Inlet D is located at the top right corner.
Liquid from Inlet D will move downward, passing through the yellow and gray baffles, leading towards container F.
Inlets A and B will direct the liquid towards container E.
Inlets C and D will direct the liquid towards container F.
Liquid will flow into both containers E and F, depending on the inlet it originates from.
